speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: [sighs] Okay. Library... Library... Where did they put the library?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: [sighs] This castle looked a lot smaller from the outside.

speaker: Spike
text: [muffled] Morning, Starlight!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Whoops!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Sorry, Spike! I guess I'm still trying to find my way around. You don't happen to know where the library is, do you?

speaker: Spike
text: [muffled] Next door on the left!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Oh. Thanks!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Acceptance, mm-hmm. Altruism, definitely. Starlight, good morning, come in!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Sorry I'm late. I got a little turned around. I still can't believe you're letting me stay here... as your pupil... after everything I did.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Well, I'm not one to dwell on the past, and neither should you. The castle is your home now, and as far as being my pupil goes, I was just trying to figure out what your first friendship lesson should be!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Oh, well, it looks like you're really narrowing it down!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Oh, these are just the A's. After this, I move on to the B's!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: I know I'm just learning about friendship, but I didn't think there were this many lessons for *anything*. How do we choose?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Maybe I should pare things down a bit before we go through them. Why don't you join the others in the throne room? They're planning our trip to the Crystal Empire when Shining Armor and Princess Cadance have their baby!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Throne room! Got it! [beat] Um, which way is the throne room? [nervous laugh]

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Well, I think we should leave ASAP. I don't want to miss the Crystalling!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: But, um, shouldn't we wait for the invitation?

speaker: Applejack
text: Frankly, I'm not exactly clear on all the customs and traditions of the Crystal Empire, especially when it comes to a Crystalling.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: What's a Crystalling?

speaker: Rarity
text: Well, that's just it, darling. Princess Cadance and Shining Armor's baby is due any day, and we're still not sure. The Crystal Empire was gone for a thousand years. A lot of their customs are a bit murky.

speaker: Applejack
text: We know it's got somethin' to do with the new baby.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [quickly] And a party!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: And the Crystal Heart.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [quickly] And a party!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: And some kinda cool energy.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: And... a party!

speaker: Spike
text: It's not hard to understand. Most things in the Crystal Empire aren't. Like how I'm a big hero there, for example!

speaker: Spike
text: Eh... plus, I've had to help Twilight do a lot of research on Crystallings. Whenever a baby is born in the Crystal Empire, the parents bring it before the Crystal Heart. They get the purest shard of crystal they can find, then pick a crystaller to present the baby to everypony who comes. Then they all share the light and joy they feel, feeding it into the crystal that joins with the Heart, and increases its power! And this is going to be a royal Crystalling, so pretty much the whole empire will show up. That hasn't happened in a millennia!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: What do you mean it increases the Crystal Heart's power?

speaker: Spike
text: The energy it uses to protect the Crystal Empire, I guess.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Protect it from what?

speaker: Spike
text: I... didn't help Twilight with that part.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Hey, Twilight, can I ask you something about the Crystal Empire?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Huh! Funny you should mention it. Because I just narrowed your first friendship lesson down to three options, and one of them is in the Crystal Empire!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Really?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I found out that's where the first pony you ever cared about lives!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Sunburst?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Of course, that's just one idea. We could also go to Griffonstone. [begins fading out] Making friends with a griffon is a challenge all by itself! Or we could tag along with the CMC's the next time they try to help a pony figure out why they're special...

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: [normal] Starlight? Is something wrong?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: What? O-Oh, no, heh, those all sound great!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I know! I guess you were right – it *is* gonna be hard to choose one!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: [laughs nervously] ...Yeah.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Ugh! I am never gonna find my way around this place!

speaker: Spike
text: Gee, Starlight, what's wrong?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: I don't know, Spike. Twilight's figuring out what my first friendship lesson is, and I guess I'm not exactly thrilled with the options. Well... with one of them.

speaker: Spike
text: Which one?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Reuniting me with my first friend.

speaker: Spike
text: What's so terrible about that?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: [sighs] [narrating] *When we were foals, Sunburst knew everything there was to know about magic. He always knew just what to do. And he was always there to help me. I guess it's not surprising that Sunburst got his cutie mark in magic and... went off to Princess Celestia's school. But when he left...*

speaker: Spike
text: You blamed cutie marks and stripped a whole village of theirs, and when Twilight and the others stopped you, you went back in time and almost destroyed Equestria.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Not really stuff I'm super eager to tell Sunburst about. I mean, he's probably some big important wizard now, and... I can't even find my way around Twilight's castle.

speaker: Spike
text: Well, if Sunburst is *that* good at magic, maybe he'd appreciate your, uh... [clears throat] exploits. You should talk to Twilight about it. I'm sure she'd want to hear what you have to say.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: I know. But I don't want her to think I'm not ready to learn or that I'm not grateful for everything she's doing.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Spike! Come quick!

speaker: Spike
text: It's a Crystalling invitation!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Shining Armor's a father! I'm an aunt! Well, this settles it! Since we're going to the Crystal Empire, your first friendship lesson is going to be... reuniting with Sunburst!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Great...

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: [yawn] Um, Applejack, what is that?

speaker: Applejack
text: Oh, just a little somethin' for the young'un. Made from genuine Sweet Apple Acres apple trees. We make 'em for all the Apples, and anypony related to Twilight is practically family.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Yeah, it's okay... But it's no Cloudsdale mobile! Bam!

speaker: Rarity
Pinkie Pie
text: Ooh!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Pretty!

speaker: Applejack
text: Well, a mobile is real nice... as long as you have somethin' to lay in so you can look at it.

speaker: Rarity
text: *And* a fetching blanket to keep you warm.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I'm sure Shining Armor and Princess Cadance will love all our gifts. But I think they're more happy we'll be attending the baby's Crystalling.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Ooh! I can't wait to see all that light and love make the Crystal Heart even more sparkly and shiny!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Actually, Pinkie, the Crystal Heart is an ancient and powerful relic. Without its magic, the Crystal Empire would be lost to the Frozen North.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Wow, this Crystalling sounds pretty important. I'd understand if you wanted to... you know... wait to do a different friendship lesson when we get back.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Are you kidding? This trip is perfect! Not only do I get to see the baby *and* take part in the ceremony that helps maintain the magic of the Crystal Empire, but I'm starting my new pupil off with the most amazing friendship lesson ever! I can't wait!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Right... Me neither... [beat] Actually, Twilight, I am a little worried about meeting Sunburst.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Oh, trust me. I know what it's like to see old friends. But I'll be right there to help things along. I've broken the whole lesson down into a few easy steps to ensure this reunion goes off without a hitch!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: [reading] Step one, head to Sunburst's house and get you two started on the right hoof. Step two, get to the castle with enough time to visit the ba—

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: [gasps] Shining Armor!

speaker: Shining Armor
text: [tired] Twilight...!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I didn't know you were meeting us!

speaker: Shining Armor
text: [tired] Of course I am! It's me, right here. Here I am. Why wouldn't I come meet my sister? Though we have met before, heh-heh...

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Are you all right?

speaker: Shining Armor
text: [tired] Never better! Being a father is amazing! And wonderful, and amazing, and confusing, and amazing, but surprising too, you know? I mean, not that you'd know. You wouldn't know, I know... You know? [beat] Sorry. I haven't really slept since Cadance had the baby. Come to think of it, she hasn't either. It sure would be great to get a break.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Oh, of course! I don't know what I was thinking! You two probably need all kinds of help! I'm sorry, Starlight, but I guess combining your first lesson with this visit wasn't such a good idea.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Oh, uh, don't be ridiculous! You're an aunt now! That's *way* more important than some *friendship lesson*.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I just wish there was a way to do both.

speaker: Spike
text: Maybe there is! You've already done the work for Starlight's lesson with this list. All we have to do is follow it!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Spike, you're a genius!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: [through nervous laugh] Yeah... [through gritted teeth] genius.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Then it's settled! Shining Armor and I will head straight to the castle, and you two can head straight to Sunburst's!

speaker: Spike
text: Aye-aye, Princess!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: [nervously] Uh-huh.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Alright, big brother, let's go see this amazing baby pony!

speaker: Shining Armor
text: [snoring] Ahhh... the baby...

speaker: Spike
text: I know you're a little worried about this reunion, but I'm sure Twilight's got everything covered.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Everything *except* how I'd rather do absolutely anything else.

speaker: Spike
text: Oh, I bet she's taken that into account too. It's all part of the lesson. *Trust the lesson.*

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Right... [beat] Hey, i-is that... you?

speaker: Spike
text: Oh, yep, it sure is! Now, according to the list, Sunburst's house is—

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Why is there a statue of you in the Crystal Empire?

speaker: Crystal Pony 1
text: Because Spike the Brave and Glorious saved all of us from King Sombra!

speaker: Crystal Pony 2
text: And then again during the Equestria Games!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Really?

speaker: Crystal Pony 3
text: Really! [to Spike] Big fan.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Um, when were you going to tell me about this?

speaker: Spike
text: Nah, it's no big deal.

speaker: Crystal Ponies
text: It most certainly *is*!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: That's it! We're not going anywhere until I get the whole story!

speaker: Shining Armor
text: Before we go in, I should probably tell you. Seeing the baby might be a bit of a shock.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Come on, big brother. I've met babies before. I expect meeting this one won't be any different. [gasps]

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Of course, I could be wrong.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: The baby is an Alicorn?!

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: [tired] It looks that way.

speaker: Rarity
text: But... But... But I thought Alicorn wings had to be earned by accomplishing some great, princess-worthy deed!

speaker: Applejack
text: Yeah. How can you just be born with 'em?

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: The birth of an Alicorn is something Equestria has never seen!

speaker: Princess Luna
text: It is beyond even our understanding.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: [hushed] That's not very reassuring.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Wow! A unicorn, *and* a Pegasus! So she could be a super-strong flyer *and* have crazy baby magic!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Well, I know *all* about super-strong flying!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: And I can help keep tabs on her magic!

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: It appears her magic is more powerful than that of a newborn unicorn!

speaker: Princess Luna
text: The crowds have already started to gather.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [inhales] [blows balloon] This Crystalling is gonna be some party!

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: Do you think we should call it off?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Um, we've all faced a lot worse than baby magic.

speaker: Rarity
text: I can't imagine cancelling such a beautiful and important ceremony over something so potentially adorable!

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: In light of the little one's abilities, this Crystalling might be more important than ever. [to Cadance] Perhaps you should address your subjects and remind them of that.

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: Hm. [kisses]

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Shining Armor! Do you have everything you need for the ceremony?

speaker: Shining Armor
text: [tired] Huh? Oh, no! I still have to interview the honor guards, choose the purity crystal, and pick a crystaller!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Alright, take it easy. Pinkie can stay here with me and keep an eye on the baby.

speaker: Applejack
text: And we'll all help you with everythin' else.

speaker: Shining Armor
text: [snores] ...baby...

speaker: Rarity
text: That is, if you can stay awake long enough to tell us *how*.

speaker: Spike
text: ...and that's how we found the Crystal Heart, defeated King Sombra, and saved the Empire.

speaker: Cloudy Spinel
text: We love you, Spike!

speaker: Coral Shores
text: Yeah. Tell the one about the Equestria Games!

speaker: Spike
text: Well, as much as I love reliving my heroic deeds, Starlight and I have an important lesson to do, by order of the Princess of Friendship!

speaker: Foals
text: Awwww!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Aw, come on, Spike! I want to hear about the Games too!

speaker: Spike
text: I know you're nervous about seeing Sunburst, but it says right in step 3, to, uh, "Deal with your fears by facing them, not by putting it off."

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Ugh. Let's go get this over with.

speaker: Spike
text: Wait!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Huh? What?!

speaker: Spike
text: Knocking on the door isn't the next thing on the list!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Seriously?

speaker: Spike
text: I know Twilight can be a little nitpicky, but this is your first lesson as her pupil, and it's important that we do it right!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Fine. What's the next thing on the list?

speaker: Spike
text: [clears throat] [reading] "Before they see each other, be sure to highlight the importance of the meeting."

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: I'm pretty sure we can skip that.

speaker: Spike
text: I don't know... I mean if we skip it, the whole lesson could go south! And then you might end up taking a giant step backwards instead of forwards! Maybe you'll never be able to learn anything about friendship at all! It's almost like your whole future depends on this moment. [beat] "Highlight the importance of the meeting" – check! I can't believe you wanted to skip that!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Sunburst?

speaker: Sunburst
text: Yes? What can I do for you?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: It's... It's me, Starlight. We used to be friends?

speaker: Sunburst
text: [beat] Oh, of course! S-Starlight! My goodness, it-it's been a long time! What, uh, what have you been up to?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Me? Oh! You know, some of this, some of that, different... stuff. Right now, I'm sort of Twilight Sparkle's new pupil.

speaker: Sunburst
text: The Princess of Friendship?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Heh... yeah... that's actually kind of why I'm here. I mean, I know you're probably very busy.

speaker: Sunburst
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Well, I figured after magic school, you'd go on to do important wizard work, but...

speaker: Sunburst
text: Oh. No. Y-Yes! Uh, y-yes, that's me, yup. [nervous chuckle] Important wizard! Really busy with lots of, uh, wi-wizarding... stuff. [beat] Right. Uh, well... good to see you.

speaker: Spike
text: Huh. Maybe we should have skipped highlighting the importance of the meeting after all.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Well, I guess that's that!

speaker: Spike
text: Starlight, come on! We have to at least explain what Twilight wants!

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: [tired, amplified] Dearest citizens, I am sure you are all just as thrilled and ready for this Crystalling as myself and Shining Armor.

speaker: Shining Armor
text: [panicked breathing] I'm not ready!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Take it easy! Just pick whoever looks the most like honor guard material.

speaker: Shining Armor
text: Right... right.

speaker: Shining Armor
text: I'm sorry. Fatherhood is way more stressful than I ever thought.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: I can only imagine.

speaker: Rarity
text: Now, I know choosing the crystal of purity is a very important decision. So I have gone through the trouble of arranging them in order from incredibly pure to outrageously pure.

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Um, Rarity, don't they all sort of look the same?

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, well, to the untrained eye, perhaps. What do you think, Shining Armor?

speaker: Shining Armor
text: [incoherent stammering] *I don't know!*

speaker: Rarity
text: [hushed] I hope Twilight and Pinkie are having better luck with the baby!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Well... at least she's having... fun!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Whee!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Pinkie, hold her still!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I'm tryiiiiiiing!

speaker: Sunburst
text: So... the Princess of Friendship wants you and I to be friends again?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Heh, I know. Weird, right?

speaker: Sunburst
text: Uh, I don't understand. Did something happen to you after I left for magic school?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: What?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: No! I-I don't see what that has to do with anything. W-Why would you even ask that?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: I mean, did something happen to *you* after you left for magic school?

speaker: Sunburst
text: What? Um, no. L-Like you said, I'm a, [clears throat] i-important wizard.

speaker: Spike
text: I'm sure there's something on Twilight's list that can help here.

speaker: Shining Armor
text: Okay. I chose the honor guard, picked the purity crystal, and I know exactly who I want to be our crystaller. So, all we need is...

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: The baby?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: We're here!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: She's a *really* strong flyer!

speaker: Applejack
text: I'm guessin' that's gonna make it harder to do the Crystalling.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: It's worse than that. Without the Heart, the Crystal Empire's about to be buried under a mountain of ice and snow!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: I still can't believe you're letting me stay here... as your pupil.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Shining Armor's a father! I'm an aunt!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Your first friendship lesson is going to be... reuniting with Sunburst!

speaker: Sunburst
text: Uh, y-yes, that's me, yup. [nervous chuckle] Important wizard!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: The baby is an Alicorn?!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: So she could be a super-strong flyer *and* have crazy baby magic!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Without the Heart, the Crystal Empire's about to be buried under a mountain of ice and snow!

speaker: Rarity
text: So... not only can we *not* take part in a fabulous ancient ceremony, but we're also about to be frozen solid!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Without the Crystal Heart's magical protection, the entire city's about to become a winter wasteland!

speaker: Applejack
text: But what about when King Sombra ruled the Crystal Empire and the Crystal Heart was missin'? The city wasn't covered in snow then!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: The Heart wasn't missing. It was still in the castle. King Sombra had just hidden it.

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: I'm afraid Twilight is correct, and the storm clouds are already forming.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: I can totally fly up there and bust those puppies! No problem!

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: I wouldn't advise it, Rainbow Dash. Those storm clouds are not like the ones you know.

speaker: Princess Luna
text: This far north, the weather has a will of its own, and now it will only grow stronger, enveloping everything in its path.

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: Including the Crystal Empire!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: And us along with it!

speaker: Spike
text: There's gotta be somethin'...

speaker: Sunburst
text: I know Princess Twilight is keen on the two of us rekindling our friendship, but... it's been so long. I don't see how anything on that list is going to help.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: I know, right? It's not like there's some spell that would magically compel us to pick up where we left off.

speaker: Sunburst
text: Well, actually, there's several. Mist Mane's Material Amity, Rockhoof's Rapport, Flash Prance's Fellow... ship... [ahem] But I-I get the feeling the princess isn't looking for a spell.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: [chuckle] Definitely not.

speaker: Spike
text: Got it! [reading] "And if all else fails, ask them to share an embarrassing moment from their past, maybe even something they regret!"

speaker: Sunburst
text: Uh, I don't see how that would help.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Uh, yeah! We should just get out of your mane. It's pretty obvious this isn't going how Twilight hoped, and I'm sure you have plenty of important work to do...

speaker: Sunburst
text: What? Oh! Right, yes, heh-heh! Uh, no rest for the wizardly.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Come on, Spike.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: There must be a spell that can restore the Crystal Heart!

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: Perhaps.

speaker: Princess Luna
text: But it isn't something that either of us know.

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: The library here at the castle is nearly as extensive as the one in Canterlot. There's a good chance we can find something there!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Can you hold off the storm?

speaker: Princess Luna
text: Yes, for a time, but even our magic will eventually succumb to the power of the Frozen North.

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: We will do what we can, but you must hurry.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I don't know how long it will take to find the right spell, but you should probably tell the crowd outside to get somewhere warm!

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: And try not to mention the Crystal Heart. We don't want to start a panic.

speaker: Applejack
text: Yes, ma'am. C'mon, girls!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I'm gonna need all of your help. The crystal library is enormous!

speaker: Shining Armor
text: You can count on us, Twily!

speaker: Shining Armor
text: Where'd she go?!

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: This way!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Well, Spike, looks like my biggest fears came true. I wouldn't be surprised if Twilight decides to give up on me entirely.

speaker: Spike
text: Aw, it's not your fault. I'm the one who said all we needed was this list. [blows fire]

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: It's not the list, Spike. Or you. Or Twilight. *I'm* the one Sunburst doesn't want to be friends with.

speaker: Spike
text: I don't remember him saying he didn't want to be friends.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: He didn't have to say it.

speaker: Spike
text: Well, Twilight obviously thinks you're worth being friends with! And I do too!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Thanks, Spike. At least I have two friends, even if one of them has dragon breath.

speaker: Spike
text: [exhales] Uh, that's not dragon breath. It's freezing!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Oh, you're right! But I thought the Crystal Heart was supposed to keep the cold weather out.

speaker: Spike
text: It is... unless something's happened! Come on!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: We're just saying that it might not be the best idea to stay outside!

speaker: Tough Nut
text: I camped out all night for this spot! I'm not about to just give it up!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: Still, when you think about it, the view is just as good a little further back, like... inside your house?

speaker: Scouts Honor
text: The Crystalling ceremony is one of our most sacred traditions! And when that foal is held before the Crystal Heart, *I* plan to be as close to the action as possible!

speaker: Applejack
text: Honestly, I don't know if there's gonna *be* a Crystallin'. The truth is, the baby's an Alicorn and her magic's plum crazy, so you might not wanna be that close after all.

speaker: Tough Nut
text: A baby Alicorn? Wow, I can't wait to see that!

speaker: Scouts Honor
text: Oh, those little wings are probably so cute!

speaker: Mustafa Combe
text: I know, right?

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Look, I am a hundred percent sure the Crystalling *isn't* happening.

speaker: Mustafa Combe
text: No Crystalling, huh? Then why are they starting the fireworks show?

speaker: Shining Armor
text: Young filly... come back here!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Come to your Auntie Pinkie Pie!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: *Bridle Buck's Boat Chants*, *Hayhoof's Intonements*, *Mystic Maps and Mazes*... [groans] Anything up there?

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: Not yet! I'm not even sure how these are organized!

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: Shining Armor, I thought *you* were taking care of the baby!

speaker: Shining Armor
text: *I'm trying!*

speaker: Flurry Heart
text: Whoo!

speaker: Rarity
text: Gotcha!

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh! Or not...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Whoa!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: What is going on?!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: You want the long or the short version?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Short?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [quickly] The baby's an Alicorn and she accidentally destroyed the Crystal Heart, so Twilight and Cadance are looking for a spell to put it back together and save the Crystal Empire from turning into a giant wasteland of ice and snow.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Oh.

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: [gasps] What about this? *Trotter's Tome of Reliquary*?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I think this is it!

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: [reading] "Spell of Relic Reconstitution"! I can't believe we found it!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: It's a good thing, too! Without this, I don't know what we'd do!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oops.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: That spell was the only thing we found in the whole library that was even *close* to what we needed!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: I'm so sorry, Twilight!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: It's not your fault, Starlight. None of us were expecting any of this.

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: Do you think you can remember the spell?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I only read it through once!

speaker: Rarity
text: Well, if anypony can exactly remember something she read for the first time two minutes ago, it's you, Twilight.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I'll try. But I'm not sure how long it'll take.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Is quickly an option?

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: I'll help if I can, but we should evacuate the city just in case! You need to lead everypony to the train station before the tracks freeze over!

speaker: Shining Armor
text: We will. But between you and Twilight, I'm sure you'll remember the spell.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I only hope this spell is the one we need.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Is there anything I can do?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I don't think so. I'm just sorry about your lesson.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Oh, that doesn't matter now. Sunburst and I don't have anything in common anyway. He's a big important wizard! And I'm re-learning everything I ever thought I knew.

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: Sunburst? I don't recognize the name, but if he's an important wizard, you should bring him here. Maybe he'll know what to do if the spell fails.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: [gasps] Of course!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: You better go with her, Spike.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: [straining] Sunburst! Haven't you looked outside?!

speaker: Sunburst
text: Snow? That's... not right. The Crystal Heart—

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Is gone! The baby – Shining Armor and Cadance's baby – it's an Alicorn!

speaker: Sunburst
text: Really?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Really! And her magic is a little berserk, and well, I guess she destroyed the Heart! But Twilight thinks she can fix it and Princess Cadance thought *you* could help!

speaker: Sunburst
text: Me?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Of course! You're an important wizard in the Crystal Empire! It just makes sense!

speaker: Sunburst
text: Right... right... right right right. You know, I'd like to help, I-I really would. I-I just have so much, um, important wizard work to do around here.

speaker: Spike
Starlight Glimmer
text: Huh?!

speaker: Applejack
text: You can't stay here!

speaker: Mustafa Combe
text: Did I mention this was a *Royal* Crystalling? When the crystaller holds the young one aloft, all of the Empire will share their joy and light, and the Crystal Heart will beat stronger than it ever has before!

speaker: Scouts Honor
text: It really is a moving ceremony!

speaker: Fluttershy
text: I *really* don't think it's going to happen.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Come on, it's *freezing* out here!

speaker: Tough Nut
text: Uh, this is the Crystal Empire. We've seen snow before.

speaker: Shining Armor
text: Not like this! We don't have time to argue! Princess Cadance has decided to evacuate the city!

speaker: Mustafa Combe
text: But the Crystalling...!

speaker: Shining Armor
text: I don't know if we'll ever have another Crystalling again! The Crystal Heart... is shattered.

speaker: Tough Nut
text: It's not safe here!

speaker: Applejack
text: [groan] That's what we've been tryin' to tell you!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Sunburst, I know you're busy, but did you hear what I said?

speaker: Sunburst
text: Oh, I heard you, but-but like *I* said, when you're an important wizard, the work just piles up.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Sunburst!

speaker: Sunburst
text: [sighs] Look, Starlight, I want to help. I do. But I can't. I wish I could.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: What do you mean?!

speaker: Sunburst
text: Fixing an ancient relic? I-I can't even come close to doing something like that!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: But I thought you were an important wizard!

speaker: Sunburst
text: Well, you were wrong, okay?! I'm not an important wizard! I'm not even a wizard at all!

speaker: Sunburst
text: I know it's hard for you to understand, but not all of us end up achieving greatness.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: What? Why wouldn't I understand that?

speaker: Sunburst
text: Really? You're the protégé of the Princess of Friendship! I don't think she picks just anypony for that!

speaker: Spike
text: Technically, she's more of a student than a protégé.

speaker: Sunburst
text: Whatever. I'm sorry I'm not the big important wizard you were expecting.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Sunburst, I don't care if you're a wizard or not. I'm just surprised. You always knew so much about magic. I mean, look at all these books!

speaker: Sunburst
text: Yeah, well, reading about magic is one thing, but you don't know what it was like at magic school! To know so much and not be able to do any of it!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Well, *you* don't know what it was like to be left behind! And then getting so bitter that you steal the cutie marks from an entire village and then get defeated by Twilight and her friends, so you travel through time to get back at them, but they beat you again and teach you about friendship, but you're so terrified ponies will find out what you did that you can't make any friends!

speaker: Sunburst
text: Did you really travel through time?

speaker: Spike
text: See? I told you he'd be impressed.

speaker: Sunburst
text: I'm sorry we lost touch. Maybe if I had reached out, you could have helped me at magic school, and I could have helped you to...

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Not become totally evil? [sighs] Let's just say I know what it's like to have something you're not exactly proud of.

speaker: Sunburst
text: When you showed up thinking I was some big wizard... I'm sorry. I should have told you the truth.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: It's fine. At least we worked it all out. I think Twilight would be proud of us.

speaker: Spike
text: Well, if you ever want to tell her about it, we should probably leave now!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: [gasps] I forgot to tell you! They're evacuating the city! You need to get to the train station, unless you've got a spell here that will drive back the Frozen North and fix the Crystal Heart so the baby can have her Crystalling?

speaker: Sunburst
text: Crystalling...! Of course!

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: Push them back, my sister!

speaker: Shining Armor
text: This way!

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: Ugh!

speaker: Applejack
text: Just a little bit further, y'all! The station's just ahead!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: We have to go back!

speaker: Sunburst
text: I know how to stop this!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Uh, I think that's everything?

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: It looks right to me, but... there's only one way to find out!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: The spell failed. I don't know what else to do.

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: An old student of mine believes he does.

speaker: Sunburst
text: The baby did this?!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I tried putting it back together with—

speaker: Sunburst
text: The spell of Relic Reconstitution. No, that won't do it. The Crystal Heart's been around for millennia. Restoring a relic like this is way beyond one spell. You need to combine it with something else. Something unique to the relic itself. Something that strengthens it and provides it with power...?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: The Crystalling!

speaker: Sunburst
text: Combining that spell with the light and love of everypony gathered for the ceremony, together with... Somnambula's Weather Abjuration to clear away the snow... and a little Fledgling's Forbearance for the parents... Heh. That should curb the little one's power fluctuations.

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: You must be Sunburst. Starlight said you were a powerful wizard.

speaker: Sunburst
text: Oh, I'm no wizard.

speaker: Rainbow Dash
text: What?

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: But he studied magic his whole life! You should see his house! And since nopony has any better ideas, what do we have to lose?!

speaker: Shining Armor
text: I had planned on asking Twilight to be our crystaller, but since it seems like she'll be busy...

speaker: Sunburst
text: I'd be honored!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Well, what are we waiting for?!

speaker: Sunburst
text: Citizens! May I present the newest member of the Crystal Empire!

speaker: Mustafa Combe
text: She's beautiful!

speaker: Scouts Honor
text: Oh! It's just so moving!

speaker: Tough Nut
text: Best Crystalling ever!

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: For a pony who isn't great at magic, you did pretty well.

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: Indeed. I'm glad to see you've found a way to share your unique gift, Sunburst. You may be more of a wizard than you think.

speaker: Night Light
text: You would not believe the *crazy* weather that delayed our train. Came out of nowhere.

speaker: Twilight Velvet
text: But it was all worth it to see this peaceful little angel! Awww, so sweet! Come to your grandmare!

speaker: Applejack
text: Yeah, peaceful now, anyway.

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I suppose that spell really did the trick!

speaker: Shining Armor
text: We have Sunburst to thank for that.

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: I hope he takes his role as crystaller seriously. Something tells me the baby will need a pony like him to look to for magical advice.

speaker: Twilight Velvet
text: Cadance, darling, aren't we gonna name the poor little dear, or are we gonna spend our entire visit just calling her "the baby"?

speaker: Princess Cadance
text: We were thinking... "Flurry Heart".

speaker: Shining Armor
text: You know, to remember the occasion.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, goodness, how could anypony forget?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I think it's lovely. [kisses]

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: Well, I think you're the Crystal Empire's big important wizard, whether you like it or not.

speaker: Sunburst
text: I don't know if I'll have time for any wizarding. I'm a crystaller now. That's a big responsibility.

speaker: Starlight Glimmer
text: I can't think of anypony more qualified. Just... promise you'll stay in touch?

speaker: Sunburst
text: Hm, like I'd ever lose touch with my oldest friend.

speaker: Spike
text: What's wrong, Twilight?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I don't know, Spike. I think I have a lot to learn about being a teacher.

speaker: Spike
text: What are you talking about? Your lesson went perfectly! Starlight and Sunburst got over their past and rekindled their friendship!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: No thanks to me. I know a lot happened. I just wish I could have given my pupil the attention *she* deserves.

speaker: Spike
text: Well, I know she needed to be put on the right path, but giving her the space to make her own decisions worked pretty well. Isn't that how Celestia taught you?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: You know, I never thought about it! But I guess it is!

speaker: Spike
text: Maybe you're a better teacher than you thought.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [singsong] We're going to Manehattan, we're going to Manehattan, we're going to Manehattan...!

speaker: Rarity
text: [nonplussed] Yes, yes, Manehattan, the height of sophistication, elegance, culture... Since my boutique in Canterlot has been doing so nicely, it only makes sense for me to open one there as well.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [squeals] We're almost there! Why doesn't your face look like this?! Eee...

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, Pinkie, dear, this is just a business trip for me. I need to scour the city for the most perfect location for my new shop. And while it's lovely how excited you are, there's absolutely *no* chance of me getting swept into the– [gasps] [suddenly excited] energy, the beauty, the *majesty* of the greatest city in all of Equestria!

speaker: Rarity
text: [sighs] This city's simply a-*ma*-zing! It's just... everything, ever!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: And it's about to get everything ever-er! Because guess who I see! M-A-U-D! You know what that spells?

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] It spells Maud.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Maud, Maud, Maud! Yay!

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, you Pie sisters have just about the sweetest family traditions! Every year, you set aside a special day to spend with each of your sisters?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Yep! I do separate trips with each one, and we make it super fun by picking a different location every year! We see the sights all day and then swap gifts at sunset! And since Maud's getting her rocktorate nearby, we figured this would be the perfect spot for PSSSD!

speaker: Rarity
text: [hushed] Okay, what's the secret?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Huh?

speaker: Rarity
text: You just said 'pssst'.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: No, silly! Not psss*t*, PSSS*D*! P-S-S-S-D! Pie Sisters Surprise Swap Day!

speaker: Rarity
text: Maud!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] Boulder promised his cousin a postcard.

speaker: Rarity
text: Well, I'll just leave you two to your PSSS*D*. And now, I am off to scout possible locations for my new boutique!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Before you go, can I ask you a quick question?

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, of course.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [loudly] Will you please help me?!

speaker: Rarity
text: [nervously] Only if you let go of my leg and stand up...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Every year, Maud's PSSSD gift always blows mine away! But this year is going to be different! For the first time, I'm finally getting her a gift that's as good as the one she always gets me! There's a specialty store here in Manehattan that sells nothing but rock pouches! A rock pouch would be perfect for Boulder, and I know Maud will love it!

speaker: Rarity
text: Why, Pinkie, that really *is* the perfect gift for Maud!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I know, right? Problem is, I still need to buy one, and the store is downtown!

speaker: Rarity
text: Hmm, and you want to get a pouch for Maud without ruining the surprise... Well, luckily for you, I know exactly what you should do! Why not sight-see on a path that leads right to the pouch store? That way Maud won't get suspicious! I'll come with you to distract Maud, so...

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: ...I can sneak away to pick out a rock pouch! [gasps] And if you're coming with us, you can look at boutique locations along the way! [shouting] *It's the perfect plan!* [echoes out]

speaker: Rarity
text: Y-Yes, yes, yes, let's not get *too* excited until you actually get a pouch for Maud.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Of course. Got it. Absolutely.

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] Nothing moved him.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Maud! I'm giving you the greatest PSSSD gift in the history of ever!

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, what a spectacular view! You really can see everything from here!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] Especially the glaciation of the sloping strata. It's breathtaking.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: But not half as breathtaking as the gift I'm giving you!

speaker: Rarity
text: I-It certainly is– [grunts] –cozy... but this simply won't do! Working in a space this small would make me lose my mind!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Just like Maud's gonna lose her mind when she sees the gift I'm giving her!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Whatever you were about to say isn't nearly as good as the gift I'm giving Maud!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] You'll be pleased with yours too.

speaker: Rarity
text: Pinkie, put down that crayon! The Cantering Cook isn't that kind of restaurant!

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh... A pony could get used to eating at places like this!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] I know. It's the only restaurant in the city with nepheline syenite in their bathroom tiles.

speaker: Rarity
text: [stutters] ...Well, isn't that something! [deliberately] You know what, Pinkie Pie? Uh, maybe you could help me figure out what to order!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [hushed] We're so close to the pouch store! It's just a block away! I could practically smell it from here! If I knew what a pouch store smelled like.

speaker: Rarity
text: [hushed] Okay, remember the plan. I will stay here and distract Maud while you go get a pouch!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [hushed] Gotcha!

speaker: Rarity
text: [deliberately] Oh, why, thank you for the kind assistance, Pinkie Pie. And now I know exactly what to order.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [deliberately] You are very welcome, Rarity! Now pardon me whilst I go wash my hooves!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: *Sorry!*

speaker: Rarity
text: So, Maud... that Boulder of yours is such an interesting... ahem... character. You must tell me, how did the two of you first meet?

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] It was a dark and stormy night. Little did I know that my life was about to change forever.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [gasps] Look at that hand-stitched ten-thousand-thread-count velvet-lined rock pouch! Maud will love it! I need it!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Ungh! Huh, must be stuck! [reading] "Took a sudden vacation to Canterlot with my grandniece. Back in a few moons." Oh, no. Oh, no-no-no-no-no-no-no! Well, maybe, just maybe, he's already back from vacation and just forgot to take the sign down! [shouting and pounding on door] *Hello, Mr. Pouch Store Owner! I'd like to hear all about your sudden vacation in Canterlot with your grandniece while buying a pouch for my sister please!*

speaker: Copper Top
text: Miss, the store's clearly closed.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: But it can't be. It just can't be! If I can't get that pouch... then not only am I not getting my sister the greatest present in the history of PSSSD, but now I have no PSSSD present for my sister at all!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] ...and Boulder's been by my side ever since.

speaker: Rarity
text: [deadpan] Wow. What a surprisingly suspenseful and compelling story. I completely get what you see in him now. [gasps] Pinkie Pie, you're back! [deliberately] Oh, your hooves must be sparkling clean!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Huh? Oh, right. [sighs]

speaker: Rarity
text: Garçon! One super-deluxe two-mile-high hot fudge sundae, stat!

speaker: Rarity
text: What happened? Did you get a pouch for Maud? Tell me everything!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [inhales] [quickly] The door to the rock pouch store is locked because the owner's on a sudden vacation to Canterlot with his grandniece for a few moons, and so there's no way I can get the perfect present for Maud, and now I don't have any present for her at all, so it'll be the worst Pie Sisters' Surprise Swap Day ever! [inhales]

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, not to worry, dear! I'll just have to help you find a new present for Maud. We have plenty of time before your gift exchange at sunset and all of Manehattan to explore. We're bound to find something Maud would like. Maybe even more than a rock pouch!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: You're right! Thanks, Rarity!

speaker: Rarity
text: Maud, I can't help but notice you're staring at that marvelous giraffe. I was just wondering, any chance you could see yourself with it?

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] Only if I had a mirror.

speaker: Rarity
text: Now, Maud, I know you're a big fan of rocks, so get your camera ready, because these are the most spectacular rocks in all of Manehattan! Surely there must be something here that catches your eye.

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] [hushed] Boulder says they're all too... stuck-up.

speaker: Rarity
text: [whistles] All right. You and me, Maud, you and me. What do you think about... this? Or this? Or this? Or this? Or this? Or this? Or this? This? This? This? This? This? [repeats, accelerating into gibberish]

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] I like... that.

speaker: Rarity
text: What is it? You have to tell me! Was it this bike? This lamp? This grappling hook? What do you like?!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] I like that fissure in the sidewalk. It's an elegant example of thermal expansion and soil settlement.

speaker: Rarity
text: Fissure in thhhhhhhe soil...? *What?!* But I...! All of this...! And she likes a *crack*?!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Did she like anything?

speaker: Rarity
text: [hushed] That sister of yours is simply impossible to shop for! There's nothing she needs or wants!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] [calling out] Boulder. Boulder. Where'd you run off to? There you are. Sure wish I had something to carry you around in.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: A rock pouch was the perfect gift for Maud! Aw, and I know she would have loved the one I saw in the window! It had double stitching, a red drawstring...

speaker: Rarity
text: ...and ochre-flecked velvet lining with reinforced triple-crosshatched seams?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Yep, that's the pouch. [beat] Wait, how'd you know?

speaker: Rarity
text: Because I'm looking at one just like it! Maybe if you can catch up with him, you could ask—

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Excuse me, sir! I couldn't help but notice your nifty rock pouch! Is there any chance you'd be willing to part with it? I really need it. Like, really really *really*!

speaker: Street Rat
text: So lemme get this straight: You, uh, really really need this pouch, huh?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I believe I said really really *really*.

speaker: Street Rat
text: Well, you know, pouches like this are really hard to come by these days. But I might be able to part with it for the right price.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: So you'll sell it to me? And I'll finally be able to give my sister the perfect Pie Sisters' Surprise Swap Day present? Oh, thank you, thank you, thank you!

speaker: Street Rat
text: Hmmm. That's one sweet party cannon you got there. Tell you what. I'd be more than happy to give you the pouch for the low, low price of... *that cannon*.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [gasps] M-My... party cannon...?

speaker: Street Rat
text: Well, if you really wanna give that sister of yours the perfect present, then you'll have to give up your party cannon. So, what do you say? The pouch for the cannon.

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] Do you see the exposed chalcedony in the fissure?

speaker: Rarity
text: Probably?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [despondent] What you guys lookin' at?

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, you're back! [to Maud] Darling, I want to get one more picture of you with that astounding fissure in the sidewalk, and the inspiration just struck me for the perfect shot! Uh, be a dear and go stand behind it. Okay, now just, uh, back up a little bit! Little more! And now just a little... uh... twenty yards more! Perfect! Hold that pose! I think we found your new holiday card! [hushed, to Pinkie] So, how did it go? Tell me, tell me, tell me!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [despondent] Well, I got the rock pouch for Maud, and... that's really the only thing that matters.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, I am so glad to hear that! She's going to absolutely love it!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [despondent] Yup.

speaker: Rarity
text: "Yup"? That's it? You got your sister the greatest PSSS*D* present in the history of ever, and all you have to say is "yup"?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [despondent] Yup.

speaker: Rarity
text: But... you're Pinkie Pie. You're supposed to be all [quickly] "Oh, I'm so excited I bought the rock pouch! And I know I say excited a lot when I'm actually just *kind of* excited, but this time I'm *really* excited about how excited I am about being this excited over the rock pouch!" [normally] And then you fire off your party cannon. Say, where is your cannon? [gasps] Did you lose it? Is your party cannon lost somewhere in the big city?!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [despondent] Well... I wouldn't say it's lost. I mean, I know where it is. It's just... [sighs]

speaker: Rarity
text: I can clearly see that something's bothering you, and I want to help. But I can't help you unless you tell me what the problem is.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: [despondent] Oh, there's no problem. It just turns out that the going rate for a rock pouch in Manehattan is one party cannon. Who knew?

speaker: Rarity
text: *You gave away your cannon?!* But, but that party cannon is your everything! You absolutely love that cannon! How could you possibly part with something that means so much to you?!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Well, I finally got Maud a gift that's just as good as the ones she always gets me, and that's all that really matters.

speaker: Rarity
text: Well, I guess I understand... maybe.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Maud's going to be so excited. I can't wait to see the look on her face when she sees the pouch!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] I know, the camera loves Boulder.

speaker: Rarity
text: After the day we've had, I'm probably looking forward to the swap part of the Pie Sisters' Surprise Swap Day even more than the two of you! [giggles] And I'm not even a Pie sister! I can't wait one more second to see the wonderful gifts you've gotten each other!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Well, you're going to have to. We don't just swap, silly. We always sing the Pie Sisters' Surprise Swap Day Song first! Ready, Maud?

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] As I'll ever be.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: It's the Pie Sisters' Swap Day Sooooooong!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] Hey.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Okay, time to swap presents! Hmmmm. [licks]

speaker: Rarity
text: [growls] Just open them already!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] Thanks.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I knew you'd love it! It was all worth it! Look how happy she is! And I couldn't have done it without you. Thank you, Rarity. Okay! Time to open your present to me! Oh! You did it again! You got me the best present in the history of PSSSD! This is perfect! This is amazing! This is incredible! I love it, I love it, I love it! [beat] What is it?

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] It's little pieces of cupcake-scented paper. You know, confetti. For your cannon.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Maud... [sniffs] You know me so well. You really are the most thoughtful gift-giver in the world! I'm gonna love it five-ever! That's even longer than *for*-ever. [sighs happily]

speaker: Rarity
text: You're right, that is impressive. But it's no fissure in the sidewalk.

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] [to Boulder] Play nice.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, I'm so relieved to see that you like the pouch. Especially considering what Pinkie Pie had to give up for it. [gasps] Oh!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] What?

speaker: Rarity
text: I mean... forget I said that! I'm, I-I-I'm glad to see that you like the pouch. You can remember that part. Just forget the second part. You know, the second part where I said that Pinkie Pie had to give something up— [shrieks] Perhaps I should just stop talking now. Nothing!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Hee-hee, yay! I love my sister and my new confetti!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] Why isn't she using her party cannon?

speaker: Rarity
text: Gahhhh...

speaker: Rarity
text: [deliberately] Ooh! Wow, look how filthy my hooves are! I really should go wash them!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] Where's her cannon?

speaker: Rarity
text: No, no, stop, stop giving me that look! I can't take it! Nnnnn... [quickly] Pinkie Pie feels bad that the gifts that she always gives you are never as good as the ones that you give her!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] What?

speaker: Rarity
text: That's why she was willing to give up the party cannon for the pouch!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] She gave up her party cannon?

speaker: Rarity
text: Pinkie Pie! You might want to come over here for a second!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: I think I know what this is about. You guys wanna ride the swans. Well, there are swan *boats*, but there *are* real swans here we can ri—

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] You gave away your party cannon?

speaker: Rarity
text: [inhales] She broke me.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Nnngh, it's just... It's just... It's just... You always give better gifts than me! That's why I *had* to get you the perfect gift! [beat] Are your hooves dirty? *Where're you going?!*

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] To get your cannon back.

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] There.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Yep! That sure is the pony I got the pouch from!

speaker: Rarity
text: That's amazing! How did you know where he'd be?

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] Maud Sense.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Runs in the family!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] I'd like to return this pouch for my sister's party cannon, please.

speaker: Street Rat
text: Sorry, missy, all sales are final.

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] [slightly more forcefully] I'd like to return this pouch for my sister's party cannon, *please*.

speaker: Rarity
text: Ooh, I've never seen her like this! Look at the fire in her eyes! You'd better do what she says!

speaker: Street Rat
text: Fire in her eyes?

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh! Did she just clench her jaw?! I think she clenched her jaw!

speaker: Street Rat
text: I didn't see.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh, no! When she clenches her jaw... you know what that means?!

speaker: Street Rat
text: What? What's it mean?

speaker: Rarity
text: Trust me, you do *not* want to know!

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] I'd like to return this pouch.

speaker: Street Rat
text: [whimpering] Here! Take it, take it, *please*! Just relax that jaw of yours and turn down that fire in your eyes! [whimpering]

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Maud! I'm so happy you got me my party cannon back! Yay!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Uh-oh. I just realized something. 'Cause you gave back the pouch for my cannon, this is now the second gift you've gotten me today! And it's something I really, really wanted! You did it again! Your gifts are *always* better than mine! Next year, I'm gonna have to really step it up and—

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] Pinkie, gift giving isn't a competition. It's an expression of love, and you always make sure to give your gifts with lots of love. That's why I'll always love them, and you, five-ever. That's even longer than *for*-ever.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Awwww! [to Rarity] There you are! You've sure been washing your hooves for a long time! We've got a train to catch here!

speaker: Rarity
text: I know, but there is one more sight you two simply must see before we leave.

speaker: Rarity
text: Voila! Welcome to the future home of "Rarity For You"! What do you think of the place? Is this the right location? Did I pick a good spot?

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] No. You picked the perfect spot.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: You know, I think this might be my favorite PSSSD ever! But I can't wait 'til next year's PSSS-D-W-R!

speaker: Rarity
text: Wait. PSSS-D-W-R? What's that?

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: P-S-S-S-D-W-R! It's a new tradition that Maud and I came up with! Pie Sisters' Surprise Swap Day...

speaker: Maud Pie
text: [deadpan] With Rarity.

speaker: Rarity
text: Oh! Ohhh! Why, that's the sweetest... Oh, no. Oh, no-no-no-no-no-no. I know how good you two are at giving gifts! I'm going to have to get you both something amazing, and I only have a year to do it!

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Oh, Rarity! It doesn't matter what you get us! As long as you give your gift with love, it'll be perfect!

speaker: Rarity
text: [sighs] Why, thank you, Pinkie.

speaker: Pinkie Pie
text: Buuuut now that you mention it... I *could* use more confetti for my party cannon. You wouldn't believe how much of that stuff I go through in a day!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Hear ye, hear ye! The first *post*-cutie mark meetin' of the Cutie Mark Crusaders is now in session!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Oh! I'm sorry, Apple Bloom. I was distracted by the radiance of my cutie mark... Did you say something?

speaker: Scootaloo
text: I mean... it's pretty amazing how the colors just pop off your flank. It's kinda hard to look aw—

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Look, I know our cutie marks are amazing, but is that all we're gonna do now? Just spend our days starin' down at our own flanks?

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: [sighs] I guess not.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Yeah, I suppose that could get real boring...

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [wistfully] Yeah... [beat] This is ridiculous! We need to go out and do somethin'!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Wow, you're right!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Yeah, we need to go try new stuff like we used to!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Exactly.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Like square dancing!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Or mountain climbing! [stock yodel]

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Or square dancin' on the mountain we just climbed! [same yodel over square dancing music]

speaker: Sweetie Belle
Apple Bloom
Scootaloo
text: Yeah!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: And the more things we try, the more chances we'll have to finally get our cutie marks! Come on!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Um... Apple Bloom?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Wow... Did we really only ever do things *just* to get our cutie marks?

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: I don't know. Maybe?

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Aw, come on! We did lots of stuff that didn't have anything to do with getting a cutie mark.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Of course we did!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Absolutely!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Huh. So now that we don't have to do stuff to get our cutie marks, what is it that the Cutie Mark Crusaders actually do?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: We do exactly what we got our cutie marks in!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
Apple Bloom
Scootaloo
text: Helping other ponies!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Ponies without cutie marks!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Or ponies who've forgotten their special purpose!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Exactly! We just have to find ponies who need our help! Come on!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: But are you sure you feel content?

speaker: Big McIntosh
text: Eeyup.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Not even a *tinge* of dissatisfaction?

speaker: Big McIntosh
text: Nnnope.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Not even the *slightest* naggin' sensation that you don't really know what your purpose is in life or why you have a big apple as a cutie mark?

speaker: Big McIntosh
text: [grunts] [spits] [annoyed] Nnnope.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: The important thing to remember is that there is no rush.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: The three of us tried for the *longest* time, but it just comes when it comes!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: And it's totally normal to feel confused and maybe even a little lost. But being a blank flank is nothing to be ashamed of.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: So if you're having even the slightest problem...

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: ...or concerns or questions...

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: ...we want you to know that we are here to help.

speaker: Mrs Cake
text: I... don't think they're too worried about it yet.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: This is gonna be a lot harder than I thought.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Who knew there were so few ponies worried about their cutie marks?

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Kinda makes you wonder why *we* made such a big deal out of it for so long.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: What?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: The point is, helpin' ponies with cutie mark problems is what makes us special.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: But if we can't find anypony with a problem...

speaker: Scootaloo
text: ...Maybe *we're* not special.

speaker: Bulk Biceps
text: *Yeah!* I know exactly what you mean. You can't find a cutie mark problem. *I* have a cutie mark problem. It's so confusing, and I feel like the solution is staring me right in the muzzle.

speaker: Bulk Biceps
text: What?

speaker: Bulk Biceps
text: I see why you guys hang out here! It's cozy!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: [straining] The Crusader Clubhouse is a safe place, Mr... um... Bulk.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: A place where we faced all kinds of cutie mark problems!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: A place where we'll go on to solve even more! Startin' with yours!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: No matter how long it takes!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Or how hard it is!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: We'll solve it because that's what we do!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
Apple Bloom
Scootaloo
text: Yeah! [straining]

speaker: Bulk Biceps
text: *Yeah!*

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: So... what's your cutie mark problem?

speaker: Bulk Biceps
text: Oh, right. Uh, well, my cutie mark is a dumbbell, but I've lifted every dumbbell in Ponyville!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: [nervously] Have you tried lifting other things?

speaker: Bulk Biceps
text: You mean, not dumbbells?

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Yeah!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Yeah!

speaker: Bulk Biceps
text: *Yeah!*

speaker: Bulk Biceps
text: Oof! I mean... no. I hadn't thought of that. *You guys are awesome!*

speaker: Bulk Biceps
text: But... what happens when I run out of other stuff?

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: ...I guess you could teach other ponies to lift things?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Yeah!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Yeah!

speaker: Bulk Biceps
text: *Yeah!* Wow, you three really have a knack for this!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: That *was* easy!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Maybe *too* easy.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Well, it's lookin' like cutie mark problems are few and far between.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: And...?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: And what if we never find another one?

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Well...

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: And even if we do, we could solve it so quick, it'll be like it never happened in the first place!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: So... then the Cutie Mark Crusaders don't have any reason to exist!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: The problem boils down to this – we don't need to go out and do things anymore to get our cutie marks.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Right! And—

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Ponies with cutie mark problems are hard to find.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Exactly. But even when we find problems, we're so good at solvin' them that most of the time there's nothin' for the Cutie Mark Crusaders to do. So...

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: I thought we should start figurin' out ways to search all of Equestria for cutie mark problems!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: That kinda seems like a lot.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: I don't think Rarity would let me travel to the far reaches of Equestria looking for cutie mark problems.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Yeah, I'm sure we'll come across them in Ponyville. And when we do, we'll totally solve them because we are so awesome at it!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
Scootaloo
text: Hoof!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: But... what do we do *until* then?

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Maybe whatever we want?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Well, we used to only do stuff to get our cutie marks or fulfill our destiny, but now we don't have to.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: So... we can do things just for fun? Are you girls thinkin' what I'm thinkin'?!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
Scootaloo
text: Sure am!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Makin' potions!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: [simultaneously] Scootering!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: [simultaneously] Singing!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Just remember – stomp, kick, and roll! After this, you two are gonna love scootering as much as me!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: If you say so.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Ready? Stomp, kick, and roll! Whooo!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Ta-da!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [nervous laugh] I don't think I did it right.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: [blows pitch pipe] Do... Mi... So... It's just a simple harmony.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Harmony, huh?

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: [tapping with baton] And a-one, and a-two, and a-one two three! [on-key] Do...

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [simultaneously, off-key] So...!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: [simultaneously, *very* off-key] *Mi!* Wow, that *was* simple!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: It's just a dash, and a drop, and a drip!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Just a dash, and a drop, and a drip!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: ...and even though Scootaloo thinks bungee jumping is the bee's knees...

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: ...Sweetie Belle would rather *keep* bees.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [spits] Of course, I'm allergic. Who'd've thought it'd be so hard to find somethin' for us all to do together?

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Well, I know this might sound crazy, but what if we didn't?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Didn't what?

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Do things together. Well, do *everything* together.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: But we're the Cutie Mark Crusaders!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: And we always will be! But I *really* wanna bungee jump! The speed, the height, the fall!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: And I know you two aren't interested, but I wanna try crochet.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Isn't there something *you've* always wanted to do on your own?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: I don't know... I guess I figured we'd always do stuff together. But bungee jumping sounds just as scary as crochet sounds borin'.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: That's okay. Sweetie Belle and I can do the things we like, and you can do whatever you like!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Just as soon as you figure out what it is.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: I guess...

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Great! Then we can meet back here and talk all about what we've done!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: But I don't know what it'll be.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: You'll find something!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Something awesome!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [sighs] Well... I guess now I have to.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text:
I never imagined myself out on my own
Tryin' to find out what's next for me
The Cutie Mark Crusaders have always been my home
Maybe now there's more that I could be

speaker: Apple Bloom
text:
I guess as time goes by
Everypony has to go out on their own
And maybe someday I'll have to try
Somethin' new that's just for me
A little somethin' that could be
Just my own and I won't feel so left behind

speaker: Apple Bloom
text:
We used to say that we'd be always side by side
Maybe things are changin' and this could mean goodbye
I always thought our friendship was all I'd ever need
We've always been crusadin' – what else is there for me?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text:
I guess as time goes by
Everypony has to go out on their own
And maybe someday I'll have to try
Somethin' new that's just for me
A little somethin' that could be
Just my own and I won't feel so left behind

speaker: Hoofer Steps
text: [muffled] And *one*, two, three, four, *two*, two, three, four, *one*, two, three, four, *two*, two, three, four—

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Whatever kind of dancin' y'all are doin', you're doin' it together, and I want in! [beat] I-I mean, uh, [clears throat] Would it be okay if I enrolled in this dance class?

speaker: Hoofer Steps
text: Well, let's see what you can do. We have a recital at town hall tonight, and a spot just opened up! [hushed] Tender Taps is a little too shy to perform. But if you're ready to step into a partnered routine...

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: That sounds an awful lot like friendship! And I'm ready for anything I don't have to do by myself!

speaker: Hoofer Steps
text: Well then! Dancing with partner will be perfect. [claps]

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Whooooooa!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Whoa, whoaaa!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Whew! I feel like that went pretty good, but let's give it one more whirl, because it's important that I do a good job partnering with my new group of friends.

speaker: Hoofer Steps
text: Eh... Now I'm think of it, you might be better as soloist.

speaker: Hoofer Steps
text: Uh, partnering is a little advanced for you. But there's still lots you can do on your own.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: I'm sorry, but doin' stuff on my own is exactly what I *don't* want.

speaker: Tender Taps
text: Sorry it didn't work out.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Tryin' different things with my friends is always fun, even when we were terrible. Now it's *just* terrible.

speaker: Tender Taps
text: You weren't that bad. You just need to learn a few things on your own. Being a soloist can be fun! [tap dancing] Ha. Haha! You just have to do it with feeling!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [sighs] Thanks, but... without my friends, I don't think I'll ever feel again. Good luck at the recital.

speaker: Tender Taps
text: Oh, I'm not gonna do that. I mean, I want to. It's kind of all I think about. I bet some day my cutie mark will even be about performing! But I could never dance in front of an audience the way I do in class. That's t-t-t-t-terrifying!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [deadpan] Yeah, okay. Nice meetin' you.

speaker: Tender Taps
text: You, too. [tap dancing]

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Sweetie Belle! You are not gonna believe this, but I think I like bungee jumping even *more* than scootering!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: *Seriously?!* That's amazing! Look what I did!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Wow, uh, that's, um...

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Horrible! But it was so much fun! Rarity showed me how, even though she says [imitating Rarity] "Crochet is knitting's poorer cousin", [normal] but I *loved* it!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Awesome!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Oh, hello, girls. Have fun pursuing your *own* interests?

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Apple Bloom? What are you doing sitting in the dark?

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Yeah, we thought you'd be out looking for things you like to do.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [laughs] I did. I looked all over town. I looked... and I looked... and I looked... and you know what I found? *Nothin'!*

speaker: Scootaloo
text: You tried every one of these?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: And each one just made me feel more alone than the next! I don't see how I'm supposed to be happy that we're not hanging out anymore!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: Wait, I never said that. I just said we don't have to do *everything* together.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Like when there's something one of us wants to do that the others don't.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Oh. [beat] Well, I guess that changes things.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: I can't believe you thought we didn't want to hang out anymore.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: I can't believe you tried all this stuff and didn't find one thing you liked!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Well, I kind of liked dancin', mainly because it looked like somethin' you couldn't do alone, but... I wasn't very good at it.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Well, you don't have to be good at something to have fun!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: And being good doesn't always mean you will.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: I know... I met the best dancer in the world, but he was so shy, he couldn't bring himself to perform, even though he really, really wanted to.

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: I don't suppose this dancing pony had a cutie mark, did he?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: You're here!

speaker: Shoeshine
text: Shhhh!

speaker: Tender Taps
text: What are you doing here?

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: You told me that you wanted to perform more than anythin', but I was too caught up in myself to listen. You're the best dancer I've ever seen, and I'm here to convince you to get out on that stage!

speaker: Tender Taps
text: Um, didn't I also tell you that dancing in front of other ponies is t-t-terrifying?! I don't know if you noticed, but that auditorium is full of other ponies! I can't go out there! What if I'm bad?!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: We can go on together! No matter what, you'll look good dancin' next to me.

speaker: Tender Taps
text: [sighs] All right, I'll do it. But I don't have my costume, and the backdrop is all wrong, and we don't have time to change it!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Leave everything to us.

speaker: Tender Taps
text: [nervously] I don't know about this...

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Don't worry, you'll be just fine!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Here goes nothin'...

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Can't be any worse than I was!

speaker: Tender Taps
text: I can't believe it! It's just what I always imagined it would be! And if it weren't for all of you, I wouldn't even have it.

speaker: Scootaloo
text: No problem!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: It's what we do.

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: I only wish I'd realized what you needed right away instead of mopin' around for no reason...

speaker: Tender Taps
text: Well, either way, I hope you keep dancing. [short tap-dancing burst]

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: [taps] You know, I just might! It sure is a lot of fun, and I'm pretty confident I can only get better. [to the Crusaders] I'm sorry I was so silly about us all doin' our own things. If we hadn't, I might never even have tried dancin'!

speaker: Tender Taps
text: Or find out I needed help!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: With each of us going out and trying things on our own, we'll be three times as likely to find ponies to help!

speaker: Scootaloo
text: And trying new stuff might even make us better at helping them, like how I used my bungee jumping to change the sets!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
text: Or my crochet to make the costumes!

speaker: Apple Bloom
text: Well, one thing is for sure. The Cutie Mark Crusaders will never be the same. We'll be better!

speaker: Sweetie Belle
Apple Bloom
Scootaloo
text: Yeah!

speaker: Rarity
text: [hushed] The last time I was here, I woke them and ended up with a mane *full* of bats! [sighs] Thanks for being my basket holder, Spike.

speaker: Spike
text: Basket holder? I thought I was your bodyguard.

speaker: Rarity
text: [hushed] What? Oh, heh, yes, yes, that of course, too. Oh, for once I wish unicorn magic wasn't so... luminescent!

speaker: Rarity
text: [hushed] Spike! You'll wake the bats! Turn that off!

speaker: Spike
text: Ugh, I can't! [groans]

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: I'm so glad you two could come!

speaker: Princess Luna
text: Of course. We so rarely get a chance to relax and just visit.

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: There's usually some crisis we have to deal with. Somepony always needs our help. But today—

speaker: Rarity
text: [muffled, wailing] Help!

speaker: Rarity
text: Twilight! There's something wrong with Spike!

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: What's wrong?

speaker: Spike
text: [grunts] I don't know! Nngh! All of a sudden, my scales just started glowing and... burning!

speaker: Princess Luna
text: Little is known about dragon culture, but this is a phenomenon we've seen before. It is the call of the Dragon Lord.

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: Dragons glow whenever the Dragon Lord has need of them in the Dragon Lands.

speaker: Spike
text: Great... H-How do I make it stop?!

speaker: Princess Luna
text: The only way to end the summons is to answer it. You must journey to the Dragon Lands and see what is expected of you.

speaker: Rarity
text: B-B-But the Dragon Lands are full of... dragons! And they're ghastly creatures! [beat] Oh, oh, not you, of course, Spikey-wikey. But remember that rotten Garble?

speaker: Spike
text: [gulps] How could I forget? He would have burnt us to a crisp if you weren't there. If I have to go to the Dragon Lands, would you two come with me?

speaker: Twilight Sparkle
text: Ooh! Oh my goodness, I'd love to! We are sadly lacking *any* information on dragon culture and customs. I could research them – maybe even write an article! This could be my chance to make a great contribution to the knowledge of Equestria! [beat] And be there for Spike, heh, of course.

speaker: Princess Celestia
text: Be very careful. The Dragon Lands are particularly dangerous for ponies. It would be wise to be discreet.

speaker: Rarity
